Starting Position: Stand tall with your feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed by your sides.
Inhale: As you inhale, raise your shoulders up towards your ears, creating tension in the muscles.
Exhale: Slowly roll your shoulders back and down in a smooth, circular motion. Feel the shoulder blades glide down your back as you complete the circle.

Rotate Both Ways: Repeat the shoulder rolls, this time rotating your shoulders forward on the inhale and backward on the exhale. Keep the movement slow and controlled.
Mindful Breathing: Coordinate your breath with the movement of your shoulders. Inhale as you raise your shoulders, and exhale as you roll them back and down.

Focus on Relaxation: Pay attention to any areas of tension or tightness in your shoulders and neck. With each rotation, aim to release and let go of this tension.
Repeat: Continue the shoulder rotations for 1-2 minutes, allowing the movement to become smooth and effortless.

Close with Awareness: After completing the rotations, stand still for a moment and notice how your shoulders and neck feel. Observe any changes in sensation or relaxation.
Optional: You can incorporate variations such as arm circles or neck stretches to further release tension in the upper body.
